city:
Aurelia-on-the-Scarp crowns a sun-baked mesa whose sheer amber cliffs overlook the Luminant Vale, a perpetual sea of silver-blue fog that rises with dawn and sinks at dusk. The city grew in concentric crescents along the scarp’s rim, each ring terraced with wind-caught banners, chain-lift platforms, and water-garden steps fed by condensing towers. At the heart stands the Heliolith, a meteoric crystal spire that hums faintly at noon and bleeds pale light at midnight; its fall, three centuries ago, fused sand into glass-veins that guide heat and memory through the bedrock. Early cliff herders and rope-sling fishers followed the glow to safety atop the mesa after dust-choked wars on the plains. They bartered windwork, resilient grains, and fog-silk with caravaners daring the Sable Road below, while learning to wring drinkable water from the breath of the Vale. Today Aurelia thrives as a hinge between sky and earth: sky-sails dock at her suspension piers, caravans spiral up carved switchbacks, and cliffward elevators creak day and night.
Aurelia’s society is braided around three necessities: water, wind, and heat. The Aquifer Collegium governs condensers and stepwells, rationing the Blue-Timers who climb to fill their hourglass tokens. The Mistral Syndic trains rope-wing pilots and moors sky kites at the Selen Gate, taxing every sail that rides the valley thermals. The Ember Ash Cohort keeps the triple forges alive on a steady feed of fossil ash mined from old caldera beds, while the Solace Guild distills fog-silk enzymes and sun-herbs into balms and tinctures coveted across the scarplands. The Ledger of Fine Weights, a counting-house guild, underwrites caravans and quietly owns much of the cliffside warehousing. Shadowing all is the Veil Covenant, a devotional society that sings to the Vale at dusk, claiming the fog thinks and remembers.
Government nominally lies with the Cliff Ministry, a rotating council of stewards selected by district lotteries weighted by water labor. In practice, factions bargain in the Wind Courts, a civic forum tuned with aeolian harps; to be heard, one must speak in lulls between the harps’ tones. Disputes include water-credit speculation vs equitable rationing, skyport mooring rights, risks of alchemical effluent seeping down the scarp, and whether to sanction the Covenant’s fog rites. Dependencies bind Aurelia to her surroundings: ash caravans must pass through bandit-haunted glass flats; skybridges remain half-ruined; condensers rust in salt winds without Solace oils; and the Heliolith’s slow dimming at midsummer has spurred rumors that its heart was plundered. Festivals punctuate life: the Chain Lighting, when the lifts blaze with meteoric sparks; the Blue Hour, a week of free condensation following the first monsoon; and Remembrance Drift, when offerings are cast upon the fog to seek counsel from those lost to the Vale. Legends insist that a sister city, Ilys the Lintel, once spanned a skybridge here and vanished in one night, leaving only a whisper-thread of wind through broken arches. Whether Ilys fell, flew, or dissolved into the fog is a debate as old as the Heliolith’s song.

surroundings.name: The Luminant Vale
surroundings.distance: Immediately below the scarp; descends for leagues
surroundings.description: A tidal sea of cool, bioluminescent vapors pooling in the canyon system beneath the city. At midday the fog thickens, feeding pendant forests of myconic shelves and fog-silk webs that tense like harp strings. At dusk it thins, revealing silhouette-limbs and glimmering pools.
surroundings.legend: The Veil Covenant tells that the Vale was once a river of voices dammed by a skyfire stone; the Heliolith’s fall severed an ancient chorus, and each mist-wisp seeks its missing note. Miners swear that on windless nights the fog returns questions whispered at noon.
resources: Fog-silk thread harvested by trained gliders
Glowcaps and bruise-blue shelf fungi used for dyes and salves
threats: Fog-lure echos that mimic loved ones’ voices
Sink-branches that flex and fold when trodden
Mist-borne corrosion that pits untreated metal
surroundings.ties_to_city: Primary source of water via condensers; spiritual locus for the Veil Covenant; hunting ground for fog-silk; a hazard for fallen lifts and lost workers.

surroundings.name: Skybridge Ossuary
surroundings.distance: Two hours by cliff path eastward
surroundings.description: The ribbed remnants of a once-magnificent bridge arching from scarp to scarp, its vertebrae like bleached bones, with wind-carved niches filled by memorial chimes. The stones thrum in storms, and broken spans dangle by ancient cables.
surroundings.legend: Said to be the spine of Ilys the Lintel, the vanished sister city. According to bridge-keepers, the last keepmaster sang an unsanctioned chord that unmoored the arch and lifted Ilys into cloud, where it still sails upside down.
resources: Memory-stone that holds faint acoustic impressions
Recovered copper ligatures used in precision instruments
threats: Loose vertebrae that shift under load
Chime-flocks that mob and peck gleaming tools
surroundings.ties_to_city: Pilgrims and windwright apprentices travel here to learn the harp-lulls of the Wind Courts; disputes over salvage rights pit the Mistral Syndic against the Cliffward Compact.

surroundings.name: Echo Quarries
surroundings.distance: Half-day mule haul north along the scarp lip
surroundings.description: A honeycomb of stepped pits and tunnels lined in pearly calcite that sings when struck. The quarried stone was used to tune courts and dwellings; now most galleries are flooded or collapsed, with ropes dangling into blue-lit cisterns.
surroundings.legend: A story claims the quarries stored the voices of Aurelia’s founders. If the right seam is cut, the city’s first bargain with the Heliolith will replay, revealing the true price paid for its light.
resources: Cistern water seeded with pale crustaceans prized by alchemists
threats: Sudden harmonic collapses triggered by loud noises
Blind salamanders that swarm to vibrations
surroundings.ties_to_city: Source of acoustic stone for the Wind Courts; disputed by the Aquifer Collegium seeking to seal cisterns and the Solace Guild that wants the salamander enzymes.

surroundings.name: Sable Caravan Road
surroundings.distance: Descends from Aurelia’s switchbacks into the flats
surroundings.description: A heat-glazed ribbon of black glass streaking across salt flats where old fires once flowed. Its surface hums at noon and cracks at night, mended by caravan crews with ash grout. Way-shrines mark scarce shade and windbreaks.
surroundings.legend: Caravan lore holds that the Sable Road was poured by a dragon dying of thirst; its last breath fused sand to a path so its hoard could be carried home. The Ledger claims the dragon’s heart still beats beneath Mile Stone Forty.
resources: Shards of heat-tempered glass smelted into blades
Salt harvested from wind-rows along the shoulders
threats: Sudden shatter-lines when the moon is closest
Heat-seeking burrowers that crack the roadbed
surroundings.ties_to_city: Aurelia’s lifeline for grain, metals, and ash fuel; controlled checkpoints enrich the Ledger of Fine Weights and the Cliffward Compact.

surroundings.name: Stepwell of Oris
surroundings.distance: Three hours west through scrub and windbreak groves
surroundings.description: A sunken amphitheater carved into the bedrock, ringed by shaded colonnades. Its water is a green coin at the bottom of a thousand steps, visited by pilgrims who descend in quiet lines bearing mirrored bowls.
surroundings.legend: The first steward, Oris, is said to sleep at the well’s heart, rising only when the city forgets thirst’s lesson. A mirrored bowl once showed a steward their doom for hoarding; it cracked when they shared their ration with a stranger.
resources: Water-scribing murals that teach condenser maintenance
threats: Drought cultists who seek to seal the well and force austerity
Scorpions that nest in the stone lacework
surroundings.ties_to_city: Sacred to the Aquifer Collegium; used to justify ration decrees; occasionally opened during the Blue Hour festival.

surroundings.name: Tangle-Root Archive
surroundings.distance: A day’s descent into the inner vale and along a ridge
surroundings.description: A grove of pale, braided trees whose roots wrap stone tablets and ceramic jars; leaves whisper with trapped words when wind threads the canopy. Wardens weave bark-ribbons inscribed with sap that glows when read aloud.
surroundings.legend: Founded by scribes who fled the Burning Colleges, the Archive is said to digest stories and grow new ones. If fed a lie, it sprouts thorns; if fed a secret freely given, it blooms night-flowers that teach a skill in dream.
resources: Guides who can retrieve a memory with the right leaf-knot
threats: Root-sinks that trap feet until a truth is confessed
Wardens who view replicators as thieves
Fog-moths that erase ink on contact
surroundings.ties_to_city: Source of deeds, genealogies, and wind-maps; contested by the Ledger, which wants exclusive copying rights, and the Veil Covenant, which guards sacred rites recorded here.

buildings.name: Heliolith Spire
buildings.description: A translucent, many-faceted monolith veined with frozen lightning and threaded by scaffolds of bronze. Open galleries ring its base, where the light is coolest; deeper within, stairwells spiral around a core that hums at noon.
buildings.history: Fell three hundred years ago, igniting sand into glass veins and attracting refugees. Early stewards cored small shards to seed condenser tech; later councils forbade further extraction after the Spire dimmed each midsummer.
buildings.secrets: A sealed chamber halfway up holds a rotating prism that redirects the hum into codes readable as star positions; the Ledger covertly employs a reader to forecast caravan hazards. Rumors of a hollow heart persist.
buildings.current_issues: Dimmer pulse noted over the last five years; debates over permitting tiny extractions to repair condensers; Veil Covenant petitions to re-consecrate the base at dusk.
faction_influence: Aquifer Collegium (technical custodianship of condenser links)
Ledger of Fine Weights (access to star-code forecasts)

buildings.name: Cascadrome Terraces
buildings.designation: Water condenser arrays and public baths
buildings.district: East Scarp, tiered along the cliff
buildings.description: Terraces of ribbed glass and stone catch the Vale’s breath. Condenser frames exhale threads of cold, beading into gutters that feed cisterns and flow through communal baths. Blue-Timer platforms schedule draws by sand-hourglass.
buildings.history: Built in three major expansions; the second after the Salt Famine, when riot damage led to the addition of public baths to cool tempers as well as bodies.
buildings.secrets: Hidden bypass valves allow discreet service to certain donors during dry spells; a buried channel leaks into a smuggler’s niche reachable by chain-lift shaft six.
buildings.current_issues: Salt creep is corroding mid-tier frames; Solace oils delay rust, but runoff has slicked climbing routes and angered the Cliffward Compact.
faction_influence: Solace Guild of Herb and Light (maintenance oils)

buildings.name: Syrinx Wind Courts
buildings.district: North Rim, exposed to constant breeze
buildings.description: An open amphitheater fluted with aeolian harps. Speakers must time words between notes to be transcribed by wind-scribes using ribboned kites. Stone seats warm at dawn, cool at dusk.
buildings.history: Founded when quarrelers realized shouting toppled scaffoldings in early days. The Courts’ tuning stones came from Echo Quarries, each trench resonating at a specific hour.
buildings.secrets: A concealed subchamber collects and stores breath from entire sessions, which the Ledger believes can be condensed into truth-distilled water; the Veil Covenant calls it theft of wind spirit.
buildings.current_issues: Legal backlog over sky-mooring rights; wave of petitions from fog-silk harvesters injured by new glider harnesses; debate on banning voice-snow magic that dampens the harps.
faction_influence: Ledger of Fine Weights (procedural leverage via bonds)

buildings.name: Ternary Crucible
buildings.description: Three interlocked kilns sharing a heat-heart, venting through a braided stack capped with a storm vane. Sparks drawn into catch-webs are collected for micro-ignitions in clockworks.
buildings.history: Raised during the Second Build to smelt glass-vein steel and anneal wind-pipe tubing. Survived an ash strike that vitrified half the Quarter.
buildings.secrets: A fourth, hidden hearth used for hush-casting memory keys for the Ledger; an old tunnel leads to a buried ash pocket that breathes methane on moon-low nights.
buildings.current_issues: Fuel prices up due to banditry on the Sable Road; ash-lung cases rising among workers; Ember Ash Cohort resists new mask ordinance mandated by the Ministry.
faction_influence: Ember Ash Cohort (work crews and supply)
Ledger of Fine Weights (contracts and insurance)

buildings.name: Under-Arcum Bazaar
buildings.description: A maze of overlapping archways where light knifes in at odd angles. Stalls hang from chains; vendors hawk fog-silk, memory shards, and spice. A chime at the seventh hour warns of lift-shifts above.
buildings.history: Grew from the scaffolds that once braced the Heliolith. Official recognition came after a failed attempt to seal it drove commerce into the condensers’ service tunnels.
buildings.secrets: A rotating code of lantern colors signals which smuggler alleys are safe; a self-swallowing stair leads to a pocket where sound does not carry, used for delicate negotiations.
buildings.current_issues: Ledger tax collectors and Covenant proselytes compete for attention; counterfeit Blue-Timer tokens appear; rumors of a fog-born parasite that stows away in dried herbs.
faction_influence: Veil Covenant (ritual presence and charity bowls)
Solace Guild of Herb and Light (stall monopoly on medicinals)

buildings.name: Cliff Ministry Hall
buildings.description: A long hall faced with cliff-amber and strung with chain-lift pulleys running through its spine. Petitioners queue between moving cages; clerk-counters flick abacuses while lift bells ring code-patterns overhead.
buildings.history: Established when lift traffic surpassed market traffic. The Ministry’s impartiality was secured by dedicating its central beam to the Stepwell of Oris, a reminder that all chains pull on the same water.
buildings.secrets: A ghost chain appears at midnight on the equinox, an image burned in by the Heliolith’s light; those who grasp it swear they feel the weight of decisions not yet made.
buildings.current_issues: Factional pressure to adjust lot-weights in council lotteries; allegations of bribe-rattles placed in petitioners’ cages; lift failures traced to salt creep.

buildings.name: Selen Gate Skyport
buildings.district: West Rim, over the broadest fog expanse
buildings.description: A bouquet of long, flexible piers anchored to cliff bollards, draped with catch-nets and wind-sock banners. Launch decks tilt to kiss updrafts; mooring clerks ride wheeled harnesses along catenary lines.
buildings.history: Erected after a series of pilot-led strikes forced the Ministry to codify sky lanes. Expanded with bonewood spars imported at ruinous cost.
buildings.secrets: A hidden mooring ring beneath Pier Three is reserved for night arrivals from unlisted ports; the Syndic keeps a ledger-within-the-ledger here.
buildings.current_issues: Harsh cross-shears have torn three sails this season; petition to add a second ring of nets contested by balcony residents losing their view; Covenant singers fined for dusk gatherings that ‘spook’ launches.

politics.name: Aquifer Collegium
politics.leadership: Arch-Condensor Meret Hal and a council of stepwell wardens
politics.motto: Measure the breath, share the cup
politics.methods: Ration tokens, condenser maintenance crews, stepwell audits, drought modeling using echo-stones
resources: Technical manuals and scribing rights at the Stepwell of Oris
goals: Stabilize ration schedules despite rising salt creep
Prohibit unlicensed alchemical additives near watercourses
Secure formal authority over emergency Blue Hour declarations
rivals: Solace Guild of Herb and Light
politics.public_support: Respected for competence but resented for ration stringency
politics.current_conflict: Facing accusations of secret bypass valves benefiting donors; pressure to open Stepwell reserves early after two weak monsoons.

politics.name: Mistral Syndic
politics.leadership: The Seven Lashers, elected by pier crews, chaired by Far-Kite Serev
politics.motto: Read the wind, write the way
politics.methods: Sky-lane charts, mooring rights auctions, escort kites for caravans, strike threats during unsafe conditions
resources: Fleet of training kites and glide-sleds
goals: Expand skyport nets and authority over airspace
Reduce safety levies on pilots
Monopolize fog-silk harvest licenses
allies: Solace Guild of Herb and Light
politics.public_support: Popular among youth and merchants needing fast mail; criticized for flight fees
politics.current_conflict: Standoff with the Compact over cross-shear hazards after several sail tears; leveraging a threatened dusk strike during Blue Hour festival logistics.

politics.name: Solace Guild of Herb and Light
politics.leadership: Matron of Mixes Ayo Solace and a circle of lamp-stewards
politics.motto: Ease the heat, lift the shade
politics.methods: Control of medicinal supply, maintenance oils for condensers, lamp-glass monopolies, apprenticeship oaths
resources: Glowcap vaults and fog-silk enzyme stores
goals: Legalize broader alchemical discharge zones
Build a new light-house to stabilize Heliolith oscillations
Undercut smugglers by opening a regulated tincture market
politics.public_support: Gratitude from patients and artisans; suspicion among traditionalists
politics.current_conflict: Accused of runoff slicking cliff routes, causing accidents; proposes absorbent moss terraces, opposed by the Ledger as unprofitable.

politics.name: Cliffward Compact
politics.type: Militia, rescue crews, and boundary wardens
politics.leadership: Marshal Thren Basso, elected by rope companies
politics.methods: Patrols along lifts and rims, emergency response, hazard zoning, enforcement of safety orders
resources: Rope stores and chain-lift control rooms
goals: Mandate stricter safety nets at the skyport
Shut down smuggler routes through the Under-Arcum
Expand rescue stipends funded by Ledger tariffs
rivals: Under-Arcum smugglers backed by shadow patrons
politics.public_support: High after rescues; wavering when patrols disrupt markets
politics.current_conflict: A series of fatal slips tied to counterfeit safety seals; suspects inside the Ministry leak lift schedules to smugglers.

politics.name: Ledger of Fine Weights
politics.leadership: First Teller Avar Jen and a quorum of weigh-masters
politics.methods: Trade bonds, caravan underwriting, market fees, quiet leverage via debts
resources: Private arbiters in the Wind Courts
Ownership stakes in warehouses and forges
goals: Privatize portions of the Cascadrome
Secure salvage rights at the Skybridge Ossuary
Bind the Stepwell of Oris to a financial trust
rivals: Solace Guild of Herb and Light
politics.public_support: Tolerated as a necessity; resented for bond foreclosures
politics.current_conflict: Facing public outcry over rumored star-code trading gleaned from the Heliolith; pushing a bill to legalize ‘predictive underwriting’.

politics.name: Ember Ash Cohort
politics.leadership: Captain of Ashes Varo Pell and cohort lieutenants
politics.motto: Feed the flame, feed the city
politics.methods: Convoys along the Sable Road, bulk fuel contracts, strike threats, muscle-for-hire on dangerous lifts
resources: A network of taverns doubling as hiring halls
goals: Win hazard pay increases
Establish an ash reserve to stabilize prices
Force the Ministry to subsidize safety equipment
politics.seat_of_power: Ternary Crucible and nearby ash yards
politics.public_support: Solid in worker districts, mixed elsewhere
politics.current_conflict: Bandit assaults on the Sable Road have spiked; the Cohort accuses the Ledger of underfunding escorts while raising tolls.

politics.name: Veil Covenant
politics.leadership: Mistmother Ilane and a chorus of dusk-singers
politics.methods: Public rites at dusk, fog-offering bowls, dream vigils, intercession at Remembrance Drift
resources: Custody of wind-bells and chime scripts
goals: Sanctioned access to the Heliolith base at dusk
Recognition of fog-rites as civil ceremonies
Protection of the Tangle-Root Archive against commodification
allies: Solace Guild of Herb and Light
politics.seat_of_power: Mist altar cirque on the East Scarp
politics.public_support: Strong among bereaved families and fog-silk workers; mocked by hard-headed traders
politics.current_conflict: Fined for obstructing skyport approaches with song circles; threatens a mass silence during the Wind Courts, which would halt sessions entirely.
